definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: As a result, civet trading in these markets was banned in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 果子狸在这些市场的贸易因而于2004年被禁。

sentences.english: The virus could jump from civet cats to humans through continuous mutation.
sentences.chinese: 该病毒可透过不断变种，由果子狸传往人类。

sentences.english: Prof Yuen said it was unlikely that people had been infected by eating civets.
sentences.chinese: 袁教授说，人们并非因食用果子狸而受到感染。

sentences.english: Civets are a popular food in southern China during winter.
sentences.chinese: 果子狸是冬季中国南部的一种很受欢迎的食物。

sentences.english: At first scientists found the virus in the catlike palm civet of Southeast Asia.
sentences.chinese: 起初，科学家们发现，在东南亚像猫掌果子狸病毒。

sentences.english: The scientists mapped the genes of the viruses taken from two of the civets .
sentences.chinese: 科学家绘制了取自两只果子狸的病毒的基因图谱。

definition: (bird species of China) crested serpent eagle (Spilornis cheela)
